column4: What is the problem if 'mount' lists my home folder as not mounted, yet I can see its contents (albeit there are problems writing to it)?
is your disk full?
nowhere near it.
but it's not even listed in 'df -h'.
although I have an NTFS partition mounted under my /home, which is quite large. I wouldn't think that would affect it though.
is the NTFS partition your home partition, or is it just mounted there?
it's mounted there. My home partition is a normal ext4 partition.
did you check your /etc/fstab file?
/etc/fstab -> UUID=44C0B828C0B821DA /home/xxx/windows ntfs defaults 0 0
ok, that answers that question...
there's no entry for my home partition, but it's been working up till now, so I always assumed it was done automatically.
there's an entry for my /home in my fstab, so that's probably the error
bit odd though that I am able to use the partition though. Mind pasting your /home fstab entry? Not quite sure what to put as options.
# /home was on /dev/sdb2 during installation
cheers, will try.
But your UUID will be different of course
I think it works. Thank you!
nice :)
it's not working properly though, it lists my partition as having 160 GB (of 170 GB in total) free, but I still get error messages saying "write error: No space left on device".
maybe a Problem with permissions ? did you reboot?
I'm in a sub directory within my own home directory, and the partition is mounted as rw. Shouldn't be a permission issue.
